flexibleText:
A comprehensive meta-checklist leveraging some of the best online resources to help developers successfully develop and launch their website or web application.

These checklists shared here were used to help us launch this application.

This checklist as well as all other ch.ckl.st web-development-related checklists mentioned here are also available on GitHub as a Markdown file so that you can:

  1. Submit corrections, additions, or improvements as a pull request
  2. Copy and paste the raw Markdown into a gist to use on your own

checklistItems.label: Update dependencies
checklistItems.flexibleText:
Before launch, make sure that you update your dependencies and test for any failures or errors after the update.

At the same time, make sure that there are no liabilities hidden within your open source dependencies:

https://fossa.com/

checklistItems.label: Syntax.fm's Pre-launch Checklist
checklistItems.flexibleText:
Based on a Syntax.fm podcast episode, this checklist covers everything from SEO to Analytics to Performance, and more. Good for a general overview of what you should consider before the launch of your product:

https://ch.ckl.st/r/website-pre-launch-checklist

checklistItems.label: SEO, Speed and Security Best Practices
checklistItems.flexibleText:
This guide produced by Checkbot contains a collection of over 50 web best practices that will make your site rank higher in search results, load faster in browsers and be more secure against attacks.

https://www.checkbot.io/guide/

sections.title: Quick Pre-launch Evaluations
sections.flexibleText: These resources help with a final check before the launch of a project, helping you to review the most important issues before the launch.

checklistItems.label: The Front-End Checklist
checklistItems.flexibleText:
A comprehensive checklist of technical considerations for the front-end developer:

https://frontendchecklist.io

checklistItems.label: The Front-End Design Checklist
checklistItems.flexibleText:
A thorough listing of items to consider regarding the design of a website or application, from concept to delivery:

https://github.com/thedaviddias/Front-End-Design-Checklist

checklistItems.label: Font Loading Checklist
checklistItems.flexibleText:
Some quick tips distilled by Zach Leathernman from his exhaustive research on web fonts.

"Our goal as web developers is to maximize the experience and raise user expectations to the level of what the web is capable of delivering, but also to manage our performance budgets to ensure that we are fulfilling the promise of the web—it’s ubiquity. This checklist should help you deliver on those two often competing ideals."

https://www.zachleat.com/web/font-checklist/

checklistItems.label: Homepage as a Landing Page Design Checklist
checklistItems.flexibleText:
Homepages and landing pages have different requirements and use cases, but you can also take many of the concepts from a well designed landing page and apply them to a homepage to make it effective in ushering users towards a specific action.

https://ch.ckl.st/r/landing-page-design-best-practices-checklist

sections.title: Front-End and UI/UX
sections.flexibleText: These resources cover topics and issues that you need to review on the front-end or client-side portion of your application or website.

checklistItems.label: Node Best Practices
checklistItems.flexibleText:
This is not necessarily a checklist, but it is a series of considerations that you should make when designing your Node.js applications:

https://github.com/i0natan/nodebestpractices

checklistItems.label: Web Developer Security Checklist
checklistItems.flexibleText:
Based on a thorough list of security concerns produced by PowerDown:

https://ch.ckl.st/r/web-developer-security-checklist

checklistItems.label: API Security Checklist
checklistItems.flexibleText:
Based on Shieldfy's API Security Checklist:

https://ch.ckl.st/r/api-security-checklist

Shieldfy also recommends this collection of useful resources for building RESTful HTTP+JSON APIs.

checklistItems.label: Node.js Security Checklist
checklistItems.flexibleText:
Configurations and approaches to hardening a Node.js server:

https://ch.ckl.st/r/nodejs-security-checklist

checklistItems.label: OWASP Web Application Security Testing
checklistItems.flexibleText:
OWASP is highly regarded in the security industry. They provide a checklist of tasks to be performed during blackbox security testing of a web application. This is a comprehensive guide for serious professionals:

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Web_Application_Security_Testing_Cheat_Sheet

checklistItems.label: GDPR Compliance Checklist
checklistItems.flexibleText:
This checklist contains the key items to consider to become GDPR compliant as an entity. These requirements will give you, as a developer, a high-level understanding of how to comply with the regulation:

https://ch.ckl.st/r/gdpr-compliance-checklist

checklistItems.label: GDPR Checklist for Developers
checklistItems.flexibleText:
This checklist is intended for IT personnel and developers. It gets into the details of what needs to be implemented on a technical level in order to meet the requirements of the GDPR.

https://ch.ckl.st/r/gdpr-for-developers-checklist

sections.title: GDPR Compliance
sections.flexibleText:
The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is a data privacy law that must be followed in all European countries (but also applies to non-EU companies that have users in the EU).

According to The Start-up’s Guide to the GDPR (which we recommend you read), the GDPR will apply to you if your business is doing anything with data that relates to living people and from which you can identify those people. The GDPR applies to:

  • Those who process personal data — the GDPR regulates processing by an individual, a company or an organisation of personal data relating to individuals in the EU. Micro, small and medium-sized enterprises (including start-ups) must comply with the GDPR.
  • Those based outside the EU offering goods or services to EU data subjects or monitoring EU data subjects’ behaviour — the GDPR applies even if your start-up is based outside the EU but providing goods or services (paid or for free) to the EU or monitoring the behaviour of individuals in the EU, for example, by using web-tracking or analytics tools which monitor behavior).

2 additional resources that we recommend that you read through before using the checklists in this section:

  1. How GDPR Will Change The Way You Develop
  2. How To Protect Your Users With The Privacy By Design Framework

checklistItems.label: Technical SEO Site Audit Checklist
checklistItems.flexibleText:
This checklist should help you put together a thorough site audit and determine if anything will potentially hold back the organic performance of your site:

https://ch.ckl.st/r/technical-seo-site-audit-checklist

sections.title: SEO
sections.flexibleText: Search Engine Optimization (SEO) is important for any online presence. Some strategies can venture into shady practices, but assuring that your site or app is set up according to best practices to maximize its SEO potential is a solid practice.

checklistItems.label: "Just the Essentials" Performance Checklist
checklistItems.flexibleText:
A quick checklist of critical items that offer quick-wins in performance gains, produced by Google:

https://ch.ckl.st/r/performance-checklist-by-google

checklistItems.label: Comprehensive Front-End Performance Checklist
checklistItems.flexibleText:
A complete and comprehensive checklist of items to improve front-end performance, adapted from a post on Smashing Magazine:

https://ch.ckl.st/r/comprehensive-front-end-performance-checklist

checklistItems.label: Angular Performance Checklist
checklistItems.flexibleText:
A list of practices to help boost the performance of our Angular applications:

https://github.com/mgechev/angular-performance-checklist

sections.title: Performance
sections.flexibleText: Performance plays a major role in the success of any online venture because it affects user satisfaction and retention and SEO, just to call out a few of the fundamental issues.
